intro: Pedicularis kongboensis var. obtusata, commonly known as the Tibetan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking reddish-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
